briefTitle: Comparing Effect and Change Processes in Cognitive Behavioral Therapy and Emotion-Focused Therapy for Depression
officialTitle: Randomized Controlled Study Comparing the Therapeutic Effect and Change Processes in Cognitive Behavioral Therapy and Emotion-Focused Therapy for Depression

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

\- Moderate or major depressive episode as primary diagnosis

Exclusion Criteria:

* Serious mental illness (schizophrenia, severe bipolar disorder, recent or current psychotic episode) or intellectual disability.
* Severe alcohol or drug abuse, last 12 months.
* Suicidality last 6 months
* Severe medical issues
* If the participant is on antidepressive medication, the dosage must have been stable for more than 4 weeks, and the participant must consent to staying on the same dosage for the duration of the treatment.
* The participant is currently in another treatment for depression

primary.measure: Change in Beck Depression Inventory from session to session
primary.description: Self-report measure of depressive symptoms, ranging from minimum 0 and maximum 63. Higher scores suggests worse outcome.
primary.timeFrame: 1 week before treatment startup, 1 day after each therapy session, within 1 week after treatment, 3 month follow up, 6 month follow up, 12 months follow up

secondary.description: Self-report measure of anxiety symptoms, ranging from minimum 0 and maximum 63. Higher scores suggests worse outcome.
secondary.timeFrame: 1 week before treatment startup, within 1 week after treatment, 3 month follow up, 6 month follow up, 12 months follow up

secondary.description: Self-report measure of symptoms related to eating disorders, average scores, minimum 0, maximum 6, higher score indicates worse outcome.
secondary.timeFrame: 1 week before treatment startup, within 1 week after treatment, 3 month follow up, 6 month follow up, 12 months follow up

secondary.measure: Change in Inventory of Interpersonal problems
secondary.description: Self-report measure of interpersonal difficulties, average scores minimum 0, maximum 4. Higher score suggests worse outcome.
secondary.timeFrame: 1 week before treatment startup, within 1 week after treatment, 3 month follow up, 6 month follow up, 12 months follow up

secondary.measure: Change in The Acceptance and Action Questionnaire from session to session
secondary.description: Self-report measure of psychological flexibility, average scores minimum 1, maximum 7. Higher score suggests worse outcome.
secondary.timeFrame: 1 week before treatment startup, 1 day after each therapy session, within 1 week after treatment, 3 month follow up, 6 month follow up, 12 months follow up

secondary.measure: Change in Emotion Approach Coping Scale
secondary.description: Self-report measure of emotional processing ability, average scores minimum 1, maximum 4. Higher score suggests better outcome.
secondary.timeFrame: 1 week before treatment startup, within 1 week after treatment, 3 month follow up, 6 month follow up, 12 months follow up

secondary.measure: Change in Penn State Worry Questionaire
secondary.description: Self-report measure of rumination and cognitive processing, total scores minimum 16, maximum 80. Higher score suggests worse outcome.
secondary.timeFrame: 1 week before treatment startup, within 1 week after treatment, 3 month follow up, 6 month follow up, 12 months follow up

secondary.description: Self-report measure of self-relating, average scores, minimum 1, maximum 5, higher scores suggests better outcome.
secondary.timeFrame: 1 week before treatment startup, within 1 week after treatment, 3 month follow up, 6 month follow up, 12 months follow up

secondary.measure: Change in Quality of life questionnaire
secondary.description: Self-report measure of quality of life, average scores, minimum 1, maximum 5, higher scores indicate better outcome.
secondary.timeFrame: 1 week before treatment startup, within 1 week after treatment, 3 month follow up, 6 month follow up, 12 months follow up

secondary.measure: Change in Working Alliance Inventory - short version
secondary.description: Self report measure on experience of therapeutic alliance, average scores, minimum 1, maximum 7, higher scores suggests better outcome.
